item.title: Site Update October 2021
item.description: Henlo frens, this is a quick update to let you know what has changed with the site recently and what I plan to do going forward. Recent Articles I have posted a few articles in the past week, I guess I was just in the mood for writing after almost a month of no updates. The articles: 2nd October 2021 - Stop Bloating Your Shell 27th September 2021 - The Emacs Rabbit Hole 24th September 2021 - Modern Books Suck Books In the Modern Books Suck article I ranted about books.

item.title: Stop Bloating Your Shell
item.description: Probably my favourite part of using Linux is that I can customise my eperience. The customisation options for some of the fundamental tools I use are endless and they are customisable by design. I have probably spent more time customising, modifying and tweaking my shell configurations than any other piece of software on my system. For this article I will be using zsh as the example shell unless stated otherwise.

item.title: The Emacs Rabbit Hole
item.description: I have been using Emacs as my text editor for about a year now. I still have no idea what I am doing but at least I know why. Cosy and Powerful The Emacs client is very lightweight and it can be self-extended whilst running by using Elisp. I am not quite sure how it works as Elisp is too far down the rabbit hole and I haven’t been there yet.

item.title: Modern Books Suck
item.description: The commodification of books and its consequences have been a disaster for the human race. There is no legitimate reason for the continued printing of the modern paperback to continue. An Abundance of Nothing. Let’s state the obvious first. You walk into your local (or high street) book shop and what do you see promoted the most? Erotic fiction, books about why you should hate yourself, books promoting diets that will kill you.

item.title: I Dont Care If You Use Linux
item.description: You may have seen my previous post about Free (as in freedom) software and came to the conclusion that I want to “convert” normies to using Linux. This is not the case. I do not care if you use Linux or not, I do not care what distro you use either. Whatever works for you, works for you and that’s great. The reason I recommend that you use a Linux based OS is not that I personally gain from you doing so but that you will gain from it.

item.title: Free As In Freedom
item.description: Libre, not gratis. I won’t go into the specifics of Free Software in this article, if you would like to know more check the references at the bottom of the page. Freedom is non-negotiable Your freedom as a user is the most important aspect of the software that you use. A common phrase found online regarding services such as search engines and email service providers goes something like “if it’s free then you are the product”.

item.title: RSS is Based!
item.description: I recently started using Newsboat for RSS. Getting a proper RSS setup has been on my “cosy setup” checklist for a while. It didn’t take much time at all to get it working either. I previously just used browser plug-ins for this however this approach is terrible in practice. Now that I have a proper setup using Newsboat I can truly appreciate RSS feeds and I would recommend using them to anyone that wants to keep up to date with things without engaging with social media.

item.title: Learning German
item.description: I have decided to learn German. I have always had an interest in learning another language but due to the terrible methodology used by the education system and cringe meme apps like DuoLingo I was never motivated enough to stick them out. However I recently came to discover the Michel Thomas method after reading these articles by Luke Smith: Notes on Learning Languages and Learning European Languages (Michel Thomas). I won’t bother to summarize them here but you should definitely read them if you are interested in learning a language.

item.title: Video Games Are Over
item.description: Modern video games are an industrialised product that satisfies checklists at the cost of a unique identity and product. They are deceptively marketed and maliciously monetized. Occasionally a video game will come out that is just trying to be a fun video game. These are few and far between. This is not a nostalgia post, modern video games are genuinely terrible. Why do they suck? The simple answer and the correct one is: money.
